album_title: Words of Radiance: A Rock Opera — Act V: Unmasked
voice_instruct: A powerful rock vocalist with dramatic theatrical delivery, soaring range and emotional intensity, like a progressive rock frontman performing in a concept album

tracks.title: Veil
tracks.voice_instruct: A hard-edged, smoky female alto channeling noir detective energy, confident and dangerous, the opposite of Shallan's usual brightness
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, noir jazz-rock with Honor's Theme in minor key jazz variation on muted trumpet, smoky atmosphere, walking bass line, theatrical female vocals with attitude, concept album continuity, theatrical, undercover infiltration
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
White hat, dark coat, a smirk that hides the fear,
Veil walks the underworld and draws them near,
The Ghostbloods think they've found a useful tool,
But Veil is Shallan's sharpest, darkest jewel.

[verse 2]
I drink their wine and laugh their thieves' laugh,
I trade in secrets, working on their behalf,
Mraize, the hunter, watches with keen eyes,
But Veil has better masks, has better lies.

[chorus]
I am Veil, I am the shadow's friend,
I am the knife that cuts around the bend,
Don't look for Shallan here, she's locked away,
Veil handles what the good girl cannot say.

[bridge]
Honor's melody in minor jazz, a twist,
A theme disguised, a truth the night has kissed,
Even my ideals wear different clothes tonight,
A Lightweaver's honor is an act of sleight.

[verse 3]
But the Ghostbloods want more than I can give,
They want Shallan's truths, the ones that let me live,
And Veil can lie to everyone but one,
The girl behind the hat who's come undone.

[outro]
Veil tips her hat and disappears in smoke,
But somewhere, Shallan weeps beneath the cloak.

tracks.title: Radiant
tracks.voice_instruct: A rigid, crystalline female soprano performing martial perfection, too controlled, too precise, brittle beneath the polish
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, martial progressive rock with distorted Honor's Theme played too perfectly and too rigidly like a music box winding down, precise percussion, crystalline synths, controlled female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the mask of perfection
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Stand straight, stand tall, the way a Radiant should,
Speak clearly, fight bravely, be the force for good,
This version of me carries Blade and light,
A warrior-scholar, everything done right.

[verse 2]
I train with Pattern, Lightweaving grows strong,
Illusions thick as armor, nothing wrong,
Radiant commands the room, Radiant never breaks,
Radiant is everything that Shallan fakes.

[chorus]
I am Radiant, I am the ideal,
The version of myself that's meant to heal,
But ideals and oaths are different from a mask,
And Radiant breaks whenever truths are asked.

[bridge]
The honor theme, distorted, bright but wrong,
An oath that's built on running from the song,
I swore to speak the truth, but every word
Is layered, is a painting, is absurd.

[verse 3]
Pattern whispers, "Shallan, truth, the truth,"
The lie of Radiant cracks beneath the proof
That you can't become an ideal to escape,
You have to face the monster's actual shape.

[outro]
Radiant salutes, but her eyes are wet,
The truth is coming, and Shallan's not ready yet.

tracks.title: I Killed My Mother
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, theatrical female soprano finally stripped of all pretense, the raw unmasked voice of a child confessing the worst thing she has ever done, trembling but refusing to stop
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, devastating ballad building to cathartic crescendo, internal stormwall motif as emotional dam breaking, Honor's Theme finally pure and honest for Shallan on clean piano and strings, raw emotional female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the truth at last
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I was ten years old, the Blade came to my hand,
A spren I'd bonded, too young to understand,
My mother saw and screamed, "She'll destroy us all,"
She came at me, and I, so small, so small—

[verse 2]
I killed her. I killed my mother with a blade,
A child in a nightmare, terrified, afraid,
And then I locked it deep, I buried it in art,
Drew over the memory, sealed my broken heart.

[chorus]
I killed my mother, and I killed my father too,
The poison and the blade, I saw them through,
These are the truths a Lightweaver must speak,
And I am speaking now, though I am weak.

[bridge]
The stormwall breaks inside me, wall by wall,
The masks of Veil and Radiant start to fall,
And Honor's Theme, for once, is clear and real,
Not a performance, but the way I feel.

[verse 3]
Pattern glows, the words are accepted here,
"I killed them," and the world becomes more clear,
Not forgiven, not forgotten, just confessed,
The truth, the terrible truth, laid to rest.

[outro]
Shallan stands without a mask, at last,
Holding every piece of her shattered past.

tracks.title: The Murder of Sadeas
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor gone ice-cold, the charm stripped away to reveal something harder underneath, disturbingly calm in the verses, hollow in the chorus
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, tense noir rock with distorted industrial Thrill riff erupting for one beat then cutting to dead silence, stark contrast between violence and quiet, chilling male vocals, minimal arrangement with sudden dynamic shifts, concept album continuity, theatrical, calculated murder
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I see him in the corridor, alone,
That smile, that snake, his voice a grinding stone,
"Your father's codes will get you all killed, boy,"
He says it like my family's just a toy.

[verse 2]
He'll betray us again, he's said as much,
He'll leave us dying, and he'll smile and such,
And something in me, cold and diamond-hard,
Decides that Sadeas has played his final card.

[chorus]
I pushed the blade through Sadeas and the world went still,
No Thrill, no rage, no vengeance, just the will
To end a man who'd end my family's name,
And the silence after is my only shame.

[bridge]
The Thrill erupts, one beat, one chord, then dies,
The silence after is the real surprise,
I feel, I feel, nothing, nothing at all,
And that's the thing that terrifies Adolin.

[verse 3]
I clean the blade, I straighten my cravat,
I walk away and no one sees where I was at,
The prince who duels with honor, kills in dark,
And carries in his chest a different mark.

[outro]
Sadeas is dead, the world should feel more light,
But Adolin just walks into the night.

tracks.title: The Return
tracks.voice_instruct: A commanding, precise female mezzo-soprano making a dramatic entrance, the voice of someone returning from the dead with purpose, regal and fierce
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, triumphant progressive rock with Honor's Theme as triumphant return on full orchestra and choir, echoes of stormwall motif from her Shadesmar crossing, grand entrance dynamics, powerful female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the scholar returns
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The tower of Urithiru, ancient stone and light,
I climb the steps, returned from endless night,
They gasp to see me, dead woman walking tall,
Jasnah Kholin, back from Shadesmar's thrall.

[verse 2]
Dalinar has bonded, Kaladin has sworn,
Shallan has three faces, battered, torn,
The world I left is burning, just as I feared,
But the Knights are rising, just as I'd engineered.

[chorus]
I have returned, and I will take my place,
Not queen, not soldier, but the scholar's grace,
The knowledge that I carry from beyond
Will arm us for the war, will build the bond.

[bridge]
Honor's theme triumphant, I am home,
The stormwall echoes from the realms I've roamed,
But home is not a tower, home is the fight,
The endless, thankless labor of the right.

[verse 3]
Shallan, child, look at what you've become,
Fractured but still standing, still the sum
Of all your pain and talent, all your art,
I should have stayed, I should have played my part.

[outro]
Jasnah sits at the table, clears her throat,
And begins to plan the most important vote.

tracks.title: Queen of Alethkar
tracks.voice_instruct: A commanding, precise female mezzo-soprano wearing the crown's weight, regal authority with the undertone of someone who never wanted a throne but will not shirk the duty
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, regal progressive rock with Honor's Theme in regal variation with gravitas and weight on full orchestra, political tension in minor key passages, authoritative female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, coronation and coalition politics
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
They crown me in a room of shattered glass,
Elhokar dead, the monarchy must pass,
To the heretic, the woman, the one who reads,
While soldiers want a warrior for their deeds.

[verse 2]
The coalition fractures every day,
Azir, Thaylenah, all pulling their own way,
I hold them with logic, with evidence and proof,
While Dalinar holds them from the temple roof.

[chorus]
Queen of Alethkar, a title made of fire,
I never wanted thrones, but kingdoms require
Someone cold enough to see the math,
And wise enough to choose the narrower path.

[bridge]
The honor melody in regal dress,
A queen's variation of the oath, no less,
I will lead them with the truth as my blade,
And the decisions that must, regretfully, be made.

[verse 3]
I argue with Dalinar through the night,
About the Parshendi, about what's truly right,
Can we win a war while seeking peace as well?
The scholar-queen must answer, time will tell.

[outro]
The crown is heavier than any Shard,
And Jasnah wears it, brilliant, cold, and hard.

tracks.title: The Fourth Ideal
tracks.voice_instruct: A raw, emotionally intense male baritone wrestling with the hardest truth of his life, the voice cracking between determination and grief, a man learning to accept his own limits
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, emotional progressive rock with Honor's Theme bridge melody that echoes into Dalinar's Act VI track on clean guitar and strings, approaching stormwall motif for Thaylen Field on distant thunder and ascending strings, intense male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the hardest oath
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The words won't come, they stick inside my throat,
A bridge too far, a wall around my moat,
"I accept," but I cannot accept,
That some will fall no matter what I've kept.

[verse 2]
Moash has fallen, my brother, my friend,
He chose the darkness, chose the bitter end,
And I could not protect him, could not save,
The man who walked with me from slave to brave.

[chorus]
I will accept that there will be those I cannot protect,
The hardest words, the ones I can't deflect,
But the storm is coming, Thaylen Field awaits,
And a Windrunner must fly despite the weights.

[bridge]
Honor's Theme, my melody, my song,
I hear it echo from where Dalinar's strong,
His unity and my protection intertwined,
Two threads of the same oath, two of a kind.
The stormwall approaches, and I must choose,
To fly, even knowing some I'll lose.

[verse 3]
Syl blazes bright, a Blade of living light,
"Kaladin," she says, "you've always had the right
To grieve, to break, to fail, and still to stand,
That is the oath. Reach out and take my hand."

[outro]
The Fourth Ideal, the hardest and the true,
I cannot save them all, but I'll save you.

tracks.title: The Thrill Unchained
tracks.voice_instruct: A deep, commanding male bass-baritone in his ultimate crisis, the voice torn between the Blackthorn's rage and Dalinar's redemption, massive dynamic range from whisper to roar
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, massive collision track with full-power distorted industrial Thrill riff unchained Nergaoul corruption motif, Honor's Theme competing in opposite key, rising chromatic stormwall motif as battle crashes over Thaylen Field, all three motifs in simultaneous counterpoint, epic orchestral metal, dramatic male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the ultimate confrontation
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Thaylen Field is burning, ships aground,
The Fused descend, the thundering warhorn sound,
And in my chest, the Thrill ignites like flame,
Nergaoul whispers, "Blackthorn, play the game."

[verse 2]
The red mist closes, blood is singing loud,
I feel the hunger rising through the crowd,
Every soldier, every blade is drawn,
The Thrill unchained, and reason nearly gone.

[chorus]
The Thrill, the Thrill, it wants me back,
It pulls the Blackthorn down the burning track,
But I am not that man, I am not that sword,
I am the words I chose, I am the Lord
Of nothing, if I cannot rule my rage,
The Thrill unchained, or Dalinar uncaged.

[bridge]
The Thrill riff and Honor's Theme collide,
In D minor and D major, side by side,
The stormwall crashes over Thaylen bay,
And everything depends on what I say.

[verse 3]
Odium stands before me, God of hate,
"Give me your pain," he says, "and I'll be great
On your behalf, just give me this one thing,"
And I feel the Thrill inside me start to sing.

[outro]
The collision, the collision, three motifs at war,
Dalinar on his knees on Thaylen's shore.
